question: Stochastic effect of radiation is:-
exp: Radiation Effects Stochastic Deterministic (Non - stochastic) 1. They are not dose dependent 1. They are dose dependent 2. They have no threshold 2. They have a threshold 3. They can occur at low doses 3. They occur at high doses above threshold 4. Severity of effect is not related to dose, but probability of occurrence of stochastic effects increases as the dose increases 4. Severity of effect in directly propoional to the the absorbed close 5. It has linear relationship between absorbed dose and probability of effect, with no threshold 5. It has non - linear relationship with threshold 6. Examples: Hereditary effects, cancers, genetic mutations, chromosomal aberrations 6. Examples: Somatic effects like skin erythema, epilation, cataracts, infeility, acute radiation syndrome like hematopoietic syndrome,

question: TI-RADS is a repoing system for thyroid nodules , it is based on the following propeies except :
exp: TI-RADS is a repoing system for thyroid nodules on ultrasound proposed by American College of Radiology. It is based on:1. Composition (cystic-benign/solid-malignant)2. Echogenic foci(macro-calcifications - benign/micro-calcification - malignant)3. Shape (wider than taller - benign / taller than wider - malignant) 4. Margin (well define regular margins - benign/ irregular margins - malignant)5. Echogenicity (anechoic or hyperechoic - benign/ hypoechoic - malignant) Extra edge : Repoing Used for Based on BI-RADS Breast Imaging-Repoing and Data System Breast lesions USG MRI Mammography TI-RADS Thyroid Imaging-Repoing and Data System Thyroid nodules Only based on USG PI-RADS Prostate Imaging-Repoing and Data System Prostate lesions Multi-parametric MRI - T2 weighted imaging - Diffusion weighed imaging - Dynamic contrast enhancement

question: MUGA scan not useful in:-
exp: MUGA - Multi-Gated Acquisition scan In this scan, Tc99-m labeled RBC area injected into the patient and gamma camera is focused on hea, then the emitted radio-active substances are assessed using the gamma camera. Useful for measuring Ventricular function of the hea, Ventricular ejection fraction, Stroke volume Ventricular wall motion.

question: Radio pharmaceutical used for phagocyte study scan:-
exp: - Tc99m-Sulfur Colloid:- Taken up by 1. Phagocytes2. Reticulo endothelial cells | Used to evaluate:1. Occult abscess2. Splenic diseases3. Focal Nodular hyperplasia-| Kupffer cells - Hot uptake4. Fibrolamellar variant HCC - No Kupffer cells-Cold uptake

AERB Guidelines for Radiation protection Dose Limitations Pa of the body Occupational Exposure Public Exposure Whole body (Effective dose) 20 mSv/ year averaged over 5 consecutive years; 30 mSv in any single year 1 mSv/y Lens of eyes (Equivalent dose) 150 mSv in a year 15 mSv/y Skin (Equivalent dose) 500 mSv in a year 50 mSv/y Extremities (Hands and feet) Equivalent dose 500 mSv in a year - For pregnant radiation workers, after declaration of pregnancy 1 mSv on the embryo fetus should not exceed.

question: Iodine isotope used for radio ablation of thyroid in Graves' disease is:
exp: Radio-isotopes Half-life Uses I-131 8 days Radio ablation of thyroid gland Systemic radiotherapy of thyroid metastasis I-125 60 days Brachytherapy (prostate cancer) Radio-immunoassay I-124 4 days Positron emitter (PET) I-123 13 hours Functional scanning of thyroid gland Thyroid scintigraphy Radio-active Iodine Uptake (RAIU)
